page.title: 01NEWS
page.content:
{ THE WHARFEDALE OBSERVER}
This local newspaper was formed in 1888 and is delivered to Otley, Guiseley, Bramhope, Newall, Weston and Blubberhouses. In all, the paper gets delivered to 34 places. It is publish- ed on every Thursday and it only costs 12 pence and its circulation is over 17 000. { A LOCAL STORY IN MARCH 1985} Â£2M SUPERMARKET PLAN REJECTED IN OTLEY The complex was rejected because it would create traffic problems and the councillors heard that 759 local people had signed a petition against the complex. 250 car parking spaces would have been provided with landsca- ping. So now the local people have been left in peace from the traffic.
